title: Emily Dickinson, at Home in Her ‘Full-Color Life’
description: The poet’s house museum in Amherst, Mass., gets a vibrant, historically correct makeover, underlining that she was not just a reclusive woman in white.
dc:creator: Jennifer Schuessler
media:credit: Jillian Freyer for The New York Times
media:description: The restored parlor at the Emily Dickinson Museum in Amherst, Mass., featuring new historically accurate carpeting, curtains and wallpaper.
